ch.unibe.iam.util.graphics
Class PolygonUtilities

java.lang.Object
  ch.unibe.iam.util.graphics.PolygonUtilities
public class PolygonUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides some useful methods for working with polygons. The methods work only with simple polygons

Version:
1.0, 2001-05-01
Author:
Thomas Buchberger

Method Detail

createRegularPolygon

public static java.awt.Shape createRegularPolygon(int x,
                                                  int y,
                                                  int radius,
                                                  int sides)
creates a RegularPolygon from the specified parameters.

Parameters:
x - x-coordinate of the center point
y - y-coordinate of the center point
radius - radius of the perimeter
sides - number of sides (sides>=3)

getArea2

public static double getArea2(java.awt.Polygon p)
This method computes the area of a polygon p multiplied by 2

getArea2

public static double getArea2(int x1,
                              int y1,
                              int x2,
                              int y2,
                              int x3,
                              int y3)
This method computes the area of the triangle given by the points (x1,y1), (x2,y2), (x3,y3) multiplied by 2.

removePoint

public static void removePoint(java.awt.Polygon p,
                               int index)
This method removes the point with index i from the polygon p

removeColinearPoints

public static void removeColinearPoints(java.awt.Polygon p)
This method removes colinear points from the polygon p. To test if 3 points are colinear, the area of the triangle given by the 3 points is calculated. If it is zero, the points are colinear.

makeStandardForm

public static void makeStandardForm(java.awt.Polygon p)
This method transforms the given polygon to standard form.

isConvex

public static boolean isConvex(java.awt.Polygon p)
This method tests if the given polygon is convex. This is done by calculating for each point p_i the area of the triangle p_i-1,p_i,p_i+1. If positive and negative areas are found, then the polygon is not convex.
